title: Internal compiler error on mutable stable slice

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Internal compiler error on
rustc 1.22.1 (05e2e1c41 2017-11-22) running on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
rustc 1.24.0-nightly (0a2e9ade8 2017-11-29) running on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
also on playground
rustc 1.22.1 (05e2e1c41 2017-11-22) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu 
rustc 1.23.0-beta.2 (c9107ee93 2017-12-08) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
rustc 1.24.0-nightly (ad3543db3 2017-12-08) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

I tried this code in empty lib crate:
```rust
static buf: &mut [u8] = &mut [1u8,2,3,4,5,7];

fn tst() {
    unsafe {
        write(&buf);
        buf[0]=2;
    }
}

fn write<T: AsRef<[u8]>/* + Send*/>(buffer: T) { }
```
I expected see only message "statics require immutable values".
Instead I see
```
error[E0017]: references in statics may only refer to immutable values
 --> lib.rs:1:25
  |
1 | static buf: &mut [u8] = &mut [1u8,2,3,4,5,7];
  |                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ statics require immutable values

error[E0017]: references in statics may only refer to immutable values
 --> lib.rs:1:25
  |
1 | static buf: &mut [u8] = &mut [1u8,2,3,4,5,7];
  |                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ statics require immutable values

error: internal compiler error: src\librustc_borrowck\borrowck\mod.rs:1050: aliasability violation for static `cannot assign to data`
 --> lib.rs:6:9
  |
6 |         buf[0]=2;
  |         ^^^^^^^^

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.22.1 (05e2e1c41 2017-11-22) running on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
```
